description.shortdescription: The SensHub server provides a single management point for all of your sensor data.
description.longdescription: This is the long description of the server. Include licensing information and links to other open source modules used. Markdown is allowed for formatting.

value.name: password
value.longdescription: Set the password required to access the web interface (and for programs to access the API). This may be set to an empty string to disable authentication, this would allow anyone on the network to access the server.

value.name: logLevel
value.longdescription: Set the logging level. Messages generated by the server at this level or higher will be stored in the log file. The default is to only log warning and error messages.

value.name: httpPort
value.longdescription: The port to listen on for incoming HTTP and WebSocket connections.

description.shortdescription: Duplicate SensHub messages on a MQTT server.
description.longdescription: This plugin allows messages on the SensHub message bus to be replicated on a MQTT server and vice-versa. Use of MQTT provides maximum flexibility.

value.name: server
value.longdescription: Set the hostname or the IP address of the MQTT server to connect to.

value.name: topic
value.longdescription: Any messages posted to the 'public' topic on SensHub will be passed to this topic on the MQTT server, incoming messages from the MQTT server on the topic will be likewise replicated in SensHub.

value.name: identity
value.longdescription: The SensHub server will add a '_senshub' field containing this value to all messages sent to MQTT, this allows you to identify messages that came from SensHub.

description.shortdescription: Allows incoming WebHooks to generate messages.
description.longdescription: This plugin provides a message source that allows data from external services to be sent as messages via incoming webhooks.

description.shortdescription: Allows custom actions to be written as Lua scripts.
description.longdescription: This plugin provides an Action type that allows you to use custom scripts written in the [Lua language](http://www.lua.org) to process messages.
